data.title: Not to my taste
data.text: Dona Timo's has been in business for a long time.  My husband and I decided to try it.  They served a cup of some fishy broth to us.  The food just isn't to our taste.  The restaurant was very busy, so others apparently do like it.

data.title: Best Cantarito in town
data.text: This is a really good family place for weekends or if you want to lunch with friends try the cantarito and michelada! and for appetizer try the choriqueso (chorizo with melted cheese) they have handmade tortillas

data.title: Authentic Mexican Food
data.text: As a local my family has been coming to this restaurant for over 10 years, it is my husbands favorite, it is a small hole in the wall, with delicious Mexican cuisine, they have music on Sundays and are usually very busy, I have tried most dishes and they are all good the seafood is hit and miss,  my husband always orders the molcajete it is a fantastic amalgamation of meats, baked in the most authentic manner, come hungry and prepare to eat what the local Mexican's really eat, this is NOT for the El Torrito eater, this truly authentic. The prices are fare, the service is good, the owner now has two sites and I always see the owner/ wife bussing tables, serving food, she is attentive and very polite.  Don't let the exterior fool you it is a GEM.

data.title: Excellent Mexican Place Specializing in Seafood
data.text: Dona Timo's is in a small, unremarkable looking building on the west side of Sierra Avenue.  Don't be fooled by the unassuming looks.  The food here is fresh and full of wonderful, unique flavors.  They specialize in seafood dishes and the quality is superb.  The prices are extremely reasonable especially for seafood dishes and the portions are generous without being overbearing.  Everything is properly cooked and the wait staff is friendly and efficient.  They do have a small traditional musical group that comes in on Friday evenings -- they were very good but I must admit to not really caring for live bands while eating.  That being said, the food here is so wonderful that I would not hesitate to go to Dona Timos at any time of day including for breakfast.  With so many Mexican restaurants in Fontana, there are many good choices.  If you want to make sure you get something great, you can't go wrong here.
